.swiper-inner -->			</div> <!-- .swiper-outer -->									                <div id="article-inner">                			  			          				<h1 id="vxw1la0ml">Ocasio-Cortez Puts the Postal Service on the Path to Ruin</h1>				<!--grepo-->													<h2 id="deck" class="">She wants to fight payday lenders by getting USPS deeper involved in banking. Here's why that's a bad idea.</h2>								            	<div class="byline">																				  By <span class="author vcard"><a class="url fn n" href="https://www.theamericanconservative.com/author/rossmarchand" title="View all posts by Ross Marchand" id="p5n8bey7m">Ross Marchand</a></span> • <a href="https://www.theamericanconservative.com/articles/ocasio-cortez-puts-the-postal-service-on-the-path-to-ruin/" title="1:00 pm" rel="bookmark"><span class="entry-date" id="i10vknyfi">May 16, 2019</span></a>									</div>                       			            				<ul class="article-tools clearfix">				  <li>						<div class="fb-like fb_iframe_widget" data-href="https://www.theamericanconservative.com/articles/ocasio-cortez-puts-the-postal-service-on-the-path-to-ruin/" data-send="true" data-layout="button_count" data-width="125" data-show-faces="false" data-font="lucida grande" fb-xfbml-state="rendered" fb-iframe-plugin-query="app_id=347697165243043&container_width=0&font=lucida%20grande&href=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.theamericanconservative.com%2Farticles%2Focasio-cortez-puts-the-postal-service-on-the-path-to-ruin%2F&layout=button_count&locale=en_US&sdk=joey&send=true&show_faces=false&width=125"><span style="vertical-align: bottom; width: 112px; height: 20px;"><iframe style="height: 20px; width: 112px; background: #000"></iframe></span></div>				  </li>				  <li>				  <iframe style="height: 20px; width: 61px; background: #000"></iframe>				  				  </li>				  <!-- Place this tag where you want the +1 button to render -->				  <li id="at-gplus"><div id="___plusone_0" style="position: absolute; width: 450px; left: -10000px;"><iframe style="height: 150px; width: 450px; background: #000"></iframe></div><g:plusone size="medium" data-gapiscan="true" data-onload="true" data-gapistub="true"></g:plusone></li>				  <!-- Place this render call where appropriate -->				  		  				  <li id="at-print" style="float: right;">				  <a href="https://www.theamericanconservative.com/articles/ocasio-cortez-puts-the-postal-service-on-the-path-to-ruin/?print=1"><img style="height: 16px; width: 16px; background: #000"></a> 				  </li><!--				  <li id="at-email" style="float: right;">				  <a href="https://www.theamericanconservative.com/articles/ocasio-cortez-puts-the-postal-service-on-the-path-to-ruin/?email=1"><img src="https://www.theamericanconservative.com/wp-content/themes/Starkers/images/email_famfamfam.png" /></a> 				  </li> -->			  				  <li id="at-instapaper" style="float: right;">				  <a href="https://www.instapaper.com/hello2?url=https://www.theamericanconservative.com/articles/ocasio-cortez-puts-the-postal-service-on-the-path-to-ruin/&title=Ocasio-Cortez+Puts+the+Postal+Service+on+the+Path+to+Ruin&description=She+wants+to+fight+payday+lenders+by+getting+USPS+deeper+involved+in+banking.+Here%27s+why+that%27s+a+bad+idea.">					<img style="height: 20px; width: 20px; background: #000">				  </a>				  </li>				</ul> <!-- .article-tools --> 				              		<div class="main-image">                		<img style="height: 349px; width: 554px; background: #000">                		<div class="caption">                  			Credit: <a href="https://www.shutterstock.com/g/jessicakirsh">jessica.kirsh/Shutterstock</a>                		</div>              		</div>            	            	            	<div class="post-content">													<style type="text/css" style="">						#google_ads_iframe_\/339474670\/ADN_Native\/TAC_Native_1__container__ {padding: 10px 0; margin-bottom: 20px; border-top: solid 1px #000; border-bottom: solid 1px #000}						#related_content ul {float: right; border: solid 1px #1b3346; width: 200px; padding: 15px; font: normal 80% sans-serif; color: #1b3346; margin-left: 8px;}						#related_content > ul::before { content: "Related Articles"; font: bold 16pt sans-serif; }						#related_content > ul li{ margin:0px 0px 0px 6px }					</style>																		<p><span style="font-weight: 400">Over a decade ago, the country watched with disdain as bank executives came to Washington begging for bailouts after benefitting from a plethora of harebrained federal programs and regulations. Now, Congresswoman Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez and Senator Bernie Sanders want to repeat history. </span></p><p><span style="font-weight: 400">At an event on May 9, Ocasio-Cortez </span><a href="https://www.theblaze.com/news/ocasio-cortez-calls-for-public-option-banking-system-based-on-the-us-postal-service-model"><span style="font-weight: 400">suggested</span></a><span style="font-weight: 400"> a “not-for-profit public option for basic banking services, and we should be piloting these projects through the USPS,” meaning the United States Postal Service. It’s a proposal similar to something Sanders proposed during the last campaign cycle. Yet the USPS, currently </span><a href="https://about.usps.com/newsroom/national-releases/2019/0510-usps-reports-second-quarter-fiscal-2019-results.htm"><span style="font-weight: 400">hemorrhaging</span></a><span style="font-weight: 400"> billions of dollars, is particularly ill-suited to handle banking and lending services for millions of Americans. Postal banking would be a costly flop, failing consumers and putting taxpayers on the line for another massive bailout. </span></p><p><span style="font-weight: 400">There have been a slew of these sorts of proposals over the years, but most fail to answer a basic question: “what kind of interest rates should risky borrowers be charged?” The payday lending industry makes </span><a href="https://www.adamsmith.org/blog/if-payday-loans-were-ripping-people-off-then-thered-be-a-better-profit-margin-than-this"><span style="font-weight: 400">modest profits</span></a><span style="font-weight: 400"> charging high interest rates to really risky borrowers who are down on their luck and probably can’t get money elsewhere. Ocasio-Cortez and Sanders believe these loans are predatory and want to see rates capped and payday lenders destroyed. Presumably, then, any “postal banking” proposal would feature borrowing rates far lower than what those with low credit scores currently experience. </span></p><p><span style="font-weight: 400">But this business model just doesn’t work. Riskier borrowers tend to have higher default rates, which payday lenders make up for by setting higher overall rates. For these borrowers, a high risk necessitates a higher payoff. But lending to a default-heavy population with low interest rates means that financial losses would almost certainly not be covered. That’s why whenever there are strict “usury laws” on the books, high interest rate lenders </span><a href="http://faculty.chicagobooth.edu/tobias.moskowitz/research/Benmelech_Moskowitz_JF.pdf"><span style="font-weight: 400">close up shop</span></a>,<span style="font-weight: 400"> leaving vulnerable borrowers with even fewer options. </span></p><p><span style="font-weight: 400">Lawmakers see the beleaguered USPS as an ideal guinea pig for government experimentation precisely because, unlike those lenders, it can’t go out of business. Yet u</span><span style="font-weight: 400">nbeknownst to most, the USPS already dabbles in the financial services sector by fulfilling money orders. And they haven’t done very well compared to their (non-government-backed) competitors. A 2016 inspector general (IG) report </span><a href="https://www.uspsoig.gov/sites/default/files/document-library-files/2017/RARC-WP-16-007.pdf"><span style="font-weight: 400">notes</span></a><span style="font-weight: 400">, “Between 2011 and 2013, the number of non-postal money orders actually increased slightly, while postal money order volumes declined by 11 percent.” This trend continued: from fiscal year 2014 through 2018, money order revenue shrank from </span><a href="https://about.usps.com/who-we-are/financials/annual-reports/fy2015.pdf"><span style="font-weight: 400">$164 million</span></a><span style="font-weight: 400"> to </span><a href="https://about.usps.com/who-we-are/financials/annual-reports/fy2018.pdf"><span style="font-weight: 400">$147 million</span></a><span style="font-weight: 400"> even as companies such as MoneyGram continued to </span><a href="https://finance.yahoo.com/news/moneygram-mgi-down-2-1-133001789.html"><span style="font-weight: 400">grow</span></a><span style="font-weight: 400">. </span></p><p><span style="font-weight: 400">This failing foray into financial markets didn’t happen because of strictures imposed by Congress, a </span><a href="https://twitter.com/AOC/status/1126627555497447424"><span style="font-weight: 400">popular refrain</span></a><span style="font-weight: 400"> among progressive members of Congress like Ocasio-Cortez. The IG takes the USPS </span><a href="https://www.uspsoig.gov/sites/default/files/document-library-files/2017/RARC-WP-16-007.pdf"><span style="font-weight: 400">to task</span></a><span style="font-weight: 400">, for instance, for “selling paper money orders through digital channels, such as usps.com and the USPS Mobile app,” a move “which would likely not require regulatory approval.” </span></p><p><span style="font-weight: 400">Money losses, then, seem inevitable if the USPS veers into the banking sector. But some proponents suggest that these losses are worth it if the agency services people who truly need affordable bank accounts or loans at affordable interest rates. </span></p><p><span style="font-weight: 400">Fee-free bank accounts are already </span><a href="https://www.moneycrashers.com/best-free-checking-accounts/"><span style="font-weight: 400">widely available</span></a><span style="font-weight: 400">, offered by financial institutions with the expertise and clout to handle billions of dollars and millions of consumers. Lending, of course, is a different story, but the federal government should think twice before doling out “affordable” loans to risky borrowers. In the lead-up to the last financial crisis, those who had no business getting loans were shadily approved, and the resulting turmoil crashed the economy. Policymakers should be loath to make the same mistake again. </span></p><div id="related_content"><ul> 	<li><a href="https://www.theamericanconservative.com/articles/taxpayers-win-as-the-postal-service-gives-stamps-com-the-boot/">Taxpayers Win as the Postal Service Gives Stamps.com the Boot</a></li> 	<li><a href="https://www.theamericanconservative.com/articles/how-to-save-postal-service-without-hiking-mail-rates/">How to Save the Postal Service Without Hiking Mail Rates</a></li></ul></div><p><span style="font-weight: 400">The Postal Service has plenty of financial and management issues already. With a recently reported quarterly loss of </span><a href="https://about.usps.com/newsroom/national-releases/2019/0510-usps-reports-second-quarter-fiscal-2019-results.htm"><span style="font-weight: 400">more than $2 billion</span></a><span style="font-weight: 400">, the USPS has enough core (in)competencies to worry about without getting deeper into the banking business. Yet if Sanders and Ocasio-Cortez get their way, the USPS may end up having something in common with the worst behaving banks circa 2008: it will only survive because of a taxpayer bailout.</span></p><p><i><span style="font-weight: 400">Ross Marchand is the director of policy for the Taxpayers Protection Alliance.</span></i></p>									</div>								<footer id="articlefooter" style="border-top: solid 1px black;">										<div class="related-info clearfix">						<div class="ad300x250" style="">								<!-- Non Dreher  -->	<div id="div-gpt-ad-1429134024462-7" class="google-dfp-ad" style="display: none; max-width: 300px; max-height: 250px;" data-ad_unit_path="/3946880/interior-below-content"></div>							</div>			  					<div class="more-posts">										<h3>MORE FROM THIS AUTHOR</h3><ul class="post-links"><li><h4><a href="https://www.theamericanconservative.com/articles/with-trump-theres-smoke-and-sometimes-fire/" rel="bookmark">With Trump, There’s Smoke and Sometimes Fire</a></h4></li><li><h4><a href="https://www.theamericanconservative.com/articles/the-pentagon-incompetent-on-cybersecurity/" rel="bookmark">The Pentagon: Incompetent on Cybersecurity</a></h4></li></ul>				  					  													</div> <!-- .more-posts -->			  				</div> <!-- .related-info --><div class="OUTBRAIN" data-widget-id="AR_1" data-ob-template="Admination"></div>					<a id="post-comments"></a><a id="comments"></a>																		<h2 id="comments-head" class="disclosedown">																			<span>Hide 26 comments</span>								</h2>											<div id="article-comments">										<!-- STARKERS NOTE: The following h3 id is left intact so that comments can be referenced on the page -->			<h3 id="comments-title">26 Responses to Ocasio-Cortez Puts the Postal Service on the Path to Ruin</h3>			<ol>				  <li class="comment even thread-even depth-1" id="li-comment-9482366">    <div id="comment-9482366">    <div class="comment-author vcard">            <cite class="fn">Matt W</cite> <span class="says">says:</span>    </div><!-- .comment-author .vcard -->        <div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"><a href="https://www.theamericanconservative.com/articles/ocasio-cortez-puts-the-postal-service-on-the-path-to-ruin/#comment-9482366">      May 16, 2019 at 2:00 pm</a>    </div><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata -->    <div class="comment-body"><p>Why does this author think the US Postal Service so uniquely incapable?  In most European nations the Post Office makes a modest profit from its involvement in banking.</p></div>    <div class="reply">          </div><!-- .reply -->  </div><!-- #comment-##  -->  </li><!-- #comment-## -->  <li class="comment odd alt thread-odd thread-alt depth-1" id="li-comment-9482486">    <div id="comment-9482486">    <div class="comment-author vcard">            <cite class="fn">Kent</cite> <span class="says">says:</span>    </div><!-- .comment-author .vcard -->        <div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"><a href="https://www.theamericanconservative.com/articles/ocasio-cortez-puts-the-postal-service-on-the-path-to-ruin/#comment-9482486">      May 16, 2019 at 2:39 pm</a>    </div><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata -->    <div class="comment-body"><p>I get the author’s concerns here. I think the real issue is that the poor really don’t have access to free bank accounts from the private sector. They can’t keep their balances high enough.</p><p>So the postal service could be useful in providing free bank accounts, a place to direct deposit pay checks, and a place to turn deposits into cash. The postal service, being a part of government, might also have the ability to auto-deduct loan payments from employer paychecks, disability checks, etc… Japan uses its postal service for banking purposes, so they might be a good model.</p><p>My concerns would be more along the lines of scope creep. That what might start as a minimally profitable, conservative mechanism that is of great benefit to an under-served population, over time becomes some horrendous welfare program.</p><p>As for the postal service losing money, why hasn’t our President appointed a top-notch CEO type to work with Congress to fix this issue? I would also think that our Senate would be all over this. This is a fiscal responsibility issue.</p></div>    <div class="reply">          </div><!-- .reply -->  </div><!-- #comment-##  -->  </li><!-- #comment-## -->  <li class="comment even thread-even depth-1" id="li-comment-9482636">    <div id="comment-9482636">    <div class="comment-author vcard">            <cite class="fn">Joe O'Mahony</cite> <span class="says">says:</span>    </div><!-- .comment-author .vcard -->        <div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"><a href="https://www.theamericanconservative.com/articles/ocasio-cortez-puts-the-postal-service-on-the-path-to-ruin/#comment-9482636">      May 16, 2019 at 3:25 pm</a>    </div><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata -->    <div class="comment-body"><p>One reason the post office “loses money” is that by law it must pre-pay pension and health care costs something the rest of the government and private business are not required to do. The Republicans saddled the PO with this obligations in order to destroy it. Another good reason not to be a member of the GOP.</p></div>    <div class="reply">          </div><!-- .reply -->  </div><!-- #comment-##  -->  </li><!-- #comment-## -->  <li class="comment odd alt thread-odd thread-alt depth-1" id="li-comment-9482666">    <div id="comment-9482666">    <div class="comment-author vcard">            <cite class="fn"><a href="http://Latinos4freedom" rel="external nofollow" class="url">Pancho</a></cite> <span class="says">says:</span>    </div><!-- .comment-author .vcard -->        <div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"><a href="https://www.theamericanconservative.com/articles/ocasio-cortez-puts-the-postal-service-on-the-path-to-ruin/#comment-9482666">      May 16, 2019 at 3:32 pm</a>    </div><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata -->    <div class="comment-body"><p>Ocasio is not favorite but this is a good one,bank of america ,wells fargo etc have a big abuse specially with low accounts,those who embrace “capitalism” should be on this side too (remember competition?)</p></div>    <div class="reply">          </div><!-- .reply -->  </div><!-- #comment-##  -->  </li><!-- #comment-## -->  <li class="comment even thread-even depth-1" id="li-comment-9482777">    <div id="comment-9482777">    <div class="comment-author vcard">            <cite class="fn">AlexArr</cite> <span class="says">says:</span>    </div><!-- .comment-author .vcard -->        <div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"><a href="https://www.theamericanconservative.com/articles/ocasio-cortez-puts-the-postal-service-on-the-path-to-ruin/#comment-9482777">      May 16, 2019 at 4:02 pm</a>    </div><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata -->    <div class="comment-body"><p>Postal banking existed between 1910 and 1960 in the United States. The author seems to imply that postal banking is some hare-brained and untested scheme, when that is obviously not the case.</p></div>    <div class="reply">          </div><!-- .reply -->  </div><!-- #comment-##  -->  </li><!-- #comment-## -->  <li class="comment odd alt thread-odd thread-alt depth-1" id="li-comment-9482809">    <div id="comment-9482809">    <div class="comment-author vcard">            <cite class="fn">Martin Ranger</cite> <span class="says">says:</span>    </div><!-- .comment-author .vcard -->        <div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"><a href="https://www.theamericanconservative.com/articles/ocasio-cortez-puts-the-postal-service-on-the-path-to-ruin/#comment-9482809">      May 16, 2019 at 4:11 pm</a>    </div><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata -->    <div class="comment-body"><p>Absolutely nothing in this article is a valid argument against the post office providing basic banking services. Moreover, they seem to be working just fine all over the world.</p><p>A much better analysis can be found at:</p><p><a href="https://www.barrons.com/articles/the-pros-and-cons-of-postal-banking-1525092593" rel="nofollow">https://www.barrons.com/articles/the-pros-and-cons-of-postal-banking-1525092593</a></p></div>    <div class="reply">          </div><!-- .reply -->  </div><!-- #comment-##  -->  </li><!-- #comment-## -->  <li class="comment even thread-even depth-1" id="li-comment-9482882">    <div id="comment-9482882">    <div class="comment-author vcard">            <cite class="fn">Whine Merchant</cite> <span class="says">says:</span>    </div><!-- .comment-author .vcard -->        <div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"><a href="https://www.theamericanconservative.com/articles/ocasio-cortez-puts-the-postal-service-on-the-path-to-ruin/#comment-9482882">      May 16, 2019 at 4:33 pm</a>    </div><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata -->    <div class="comment-body"><p>Ah, another shill for Wall Street and the fiance industry.  The author would love to see pay day lenders disappear, but they are a fly on the elephant of the banks.  But offering the public something that works well in many highly developed nations might be a ‘thin edge of the wedge’ to the government providing basic services at the expense of the Robber Barrons.</p><p>Thank you –</p></div>    <div class="reply">          </div><!-- .reply -->  </div><!-- #comment-##  -->  </li><!-- #comment-## -->  <li class="comment odd alt thread-odd thread-alt depth-1" id="li-comment-9482892">    <div id="comment-9482892">    <div class="comment-author vcard">            <cite class="fn">Oleg Gark</cite> <span class="says">says:</span>    </div><!-- .comment-author .vcard -->        <div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"><a href="https://www.theamericanconservative.com/articles/ocasio-cortez-puts-the-postal-service-on-the-path-to-ruin/#comment-9482892">      May 16, 2019 at 4:35 pm</a>    </div><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata -->    <div class="comment-body"><p>I don’t know the pros and cons of the current proposals to bring back postal banking, but this article reads like a one-sided hit piece.</p><p>The words used to describe the USPS include: “beleaguered”, “guinea pig”, “dabbles”, “veers”, and “core (in)competencies”.  Furthermore, the author blames the last recession on poor people who had “no business getting loans”, as if investment banking and Credit Default Swaps had nothing to do with it.</p><p>If TAC regards their readers as smarter than the average bear, their content should reflect that.</p></div>    <div class="reply">          </div><!-- .reply -->  </div><!-- #comment-##  -->  </li><!-- #comment-## -->  <li class="comment even thread-even depth-1" id="li-comment-9482993">    <div id="comment-9482993">    <div class="comment-author vcard">            <cite class="fn">tz</cite> <span class="says">says:</span>    </div><!-- .comment-author .vcard -->        <div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"><a href="https://www.theamericanconservative.com/articles/ocasio-cortez-puts-the-postal-service-on-the-path-to-ruin/#comment-9482993">      May 16, 2019 at 5:06 pm</a>    </div><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata -->    <div class="comment-body"><p>Why is AmCon going full NR?</p><p>The Postal Service only has problems because they have to reserve actual CASH for retirees, unlike the feds or state governments, or Romney’s Bain Capitalism where the Pensions Guaranty Benefits trust fund – also taxpayers – will have to pay.</p><p>I would love to get the traditonal 4% from a postal account.</p><p>(Have you heard of Japan?)</p><p>No, you want the bankster oligarchs to make us debt slaves</p></div>    <div class="reply">          </div><!-- .reply -->  </div><!-- #comment-##  -->  </li><!-- #comment-## -->  <li class="comment odd alt thread-odd thread-alt depth-1" id="li-comment-9483060">    <div id="comment-9483060">    <div class="comment-author vcard">            <cite class="fn">swordfish</cite> <span class="says">says:</span>    </div><!-- .comment-author .vcard -->        <div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"><a href="https://www.theamericanconservative.com/articles/ocasio-cortez-puts-the-postal-service-on-the-path-to-ruin/#comment-9483060">      May 16, 2019 at 5:23 pm</a>    </div><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata -->    <div class="comment-body"><p>I’ve spent a lot of time driving through New Mexico.  A lot of it is very rugged terrain, and/or Indian reservation.  In many of its tiny towns the only civic building is the post office.  I think we’d want to closely regulate banking via post office, but the suggestion sort of makes sense.  USPS is the only federal agency with the mission (and the infrastructure) to “touch” every citizen.</p></div>    <div class="reply">          </div><!-- .reply -->  </div><!-- #comment-##  -->  </li><!-- #comment-## -->  <li class="comment even thread-even depth-1" id="li-comment-9483101">    <div id="comment-9483101">    <div class="comment-author vcard">            <cite class="fn">TheSnark</cite> <span class="says">says:</span>    </div><!-- .comment-author .vcard -->        <div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"><a href="https://www.theamericanconservative.com/articles/ocasio-cortez-puts-the-postal-service-on-the-path-to-ruin/#comment-9483101">      May 16, 2019 at 5:35 pm</a>    </div><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata -->    <div class="comment-body"><p>In Japan and many European countries the post offices are used for basic banking services, bill payments, etc.  It works well.   Letting the PO get into lending, though, is nuts, for the very reasons the author points out.</p><p>Using the PO for basic banking would utilize the thousands of under-utilized offices around the country.   Closing those offices would make more sense, but their local congressmen will never allow that.   So you might as well have them do something useful.  In theory.</p><p>But the author does raise a valid question:  can we trust congress not to mandate that the PO provide services that would lose tons of money?  The record is not good.</p></div>    <div class="reply">          </div><!-- .reply -->  </div><!-- #comment-##  -->  </li><!-- #comment-## -->  <li class="comment odd alt thread-odd thread-alt depth-1" id="li-comment-9483241">    <div id="comment-9483241">    <div class="comment-author vcard">            <cite class="fn">Brett Champion</cite> <span class="says">says:</span>    </div><!-- .comment-author .vcard -->        <div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"><a href="https://www.theamericanconservative.com/articles/ocasio-cortez-puts-the-postal-service-on-the-path-to-ruin/#comment-9483241">      May 16, 2019 at 6:21 pm</a>    </div><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata -->    <div class="comment-body"><p>So, she wants people to open bank accounts with an organization that is currently less than a decade away from going out of business without a massive government bailout. I suppose if people are already going to be ticked off about the next time we bail out the banks, then why not.</p></div>    <div class="reply">          </div><!-- .reply -->  </div><!-- #comment-##  -->  </li><!-- #comment-## -->  <li class="comment even thread-even depth-1" id="li-comment-9483262">    <div id="comment-9483262">    <div class="comment-author vcard">            <cite class="fn">cka2nd</cite> <span class="says">says:</span>    </div><!-- .comment-author .vcard -->        <div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"><a href="https://www.theamericanconservative.com/articles/ocasio-cortez-puts-the-postal-service-on-the-path-to-ruin/#comment-9483262">      May 16, 2019 at 6:27 pm</a>    </div><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata -->    <div class="comment-body"><p>Gods forbid that the author should look at those countries that already have well-established postal banking services.  And Heaven forfend that he should mention that most of the USPS’ losses are due to the Bush II era mandate to pre-fund retiree health benefits at a rate required of no other institution in either the public or private sector.  Nope, it’s the same swill we’ve been served for the last 40 years, “The market will save us!  The market will save us!”</p><p>Also, it is my understanding that the main purpose of a postal bank would be to offer savings accounts where people can actually, you know, save and build their income, and not engage in excessive, let alone high-flying, lending.  But I could be wrong about that.</p><p>One would think that TAC, with its interest in preserving small towns and neighborhoods, might have asked a writer with an interest in such to review these proposals, rather than publishing the kind of low-hanging fruit churned out by libertarian and Conservative, Inc. think tanks and citizen associations for the last five decades.</p></div>    <div class="reply">          </div><!-- .reply -->  </div><!-- #comment-##  -->  </li><!-- #comment-## -->  <li class="comment odd alt thread-odd thread-alt depth-1" id="li-comment-9483486">    <div id="comment-9483486">    <div class="comment-author vcard">            <cite class="fn">Bob</cite> <span class="says">says:</span>    </div><!-- .comment-author .vcard -->        <div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"><a href="https://www.theamericanconservative.com/articles/ocasio-cortez-puts-the-postal-service-on-the-path-to-ruin/#comment-9483486">      May 16, 2019 at 7:37 pm</a>    </div><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata -->    <div class="comment-body"><p>I’m not sure I would call using public money to fund a public institution a “bailout.” I would probably just call it “funding.” But I’m not a corporate shill.</p></div>    <div class="reply">          </div><!-- .reply -->  </div><!-- #comment-##  -->  </li><!-- #comment-## -->  <li class="comment even thread-even depth-1" id="li-comment-9486377">    <div id="comment-9486377">    <div class="comment-author vcard">            <cite class="fn">TomG</cite> <span class="says">says:</span>    </div><!-- .comment-author .vcard -->        <div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"><a href="https://www.theamericanconservative.com/articles/ocasio-cortez-puts-the-postal-service-on-the-path-to-ruin/#comment-9486377">      May 17, 2019 at 9:16 am</a>    </div><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata -->    <div class="comment-body"><p>Mr. Marchand comes off as an apologist for pay-day lenders and goes so far as to say, “Ocasio-Cortez and Sanders believe these loans are predatory and want to see rates capped and payday lenders destroyed.”  </p><p>If pay-day lenders are not predatory, I don’t know what is.  And if he thinks we won’t repeat big bank bailouts he is extremely naive.  The ‘too big to fail’ model has only expanded since the last melt-down.  </p><p>North Dakota has a long standing successful public banking industry.  Perhaps we could look at the merits rather than be dismissive on the pretense that pay-day lenders and their so called ‘modest profits’ are doing some service for the working poor.</p></div>    <div class="reply">          </div><!-- .reply -->  </div><!-- #comment-##  -->  </li><!-- #comment-## -->  <li class="comment odd alt thread-odd thread-alt depth-1" id="li-comment-9486413">    <div id="comment-9486413">    <div class="comment-author vcard">            <cite class="fn">William Gordon</cite> <span class="says">says:</span>    </div><!-- .comment-author .vcard -->        <div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"><a href="https://www.theamericanconservative.com/articles/ocasio-cortez-puts-the-postal-service-on-the-path-to-ruin/#comment-9486413">      May 17, 2019 at 9:26 am</a>    </div><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata -->    <div class="comment-body"><p>Given how well these ‘Post’ banks work in quite a few other established countries, I don’t see why one couldn’t work well, here, too.<br>If the Germans can do it, we can.</p><p>The comment on the banks being bailed out without consequences for the bankers, though – yes, that was a horrendous mistake.</p><p>Banks are given special exceptions and powers in order to lubricate the financial system. Unfortunately, they have abandoned the responsibilities that come with those exceptions and powers in favor of undeserved profit.</p><p>State run banks such as the Post work well in many countries and have for well over a century. The ‘all government is bad’ approach to economics is not wise.</p><p>Oh, and the post office wouldn’t be in such trouble is Republicans hadn’t forced such absurd pension fund demands on them to punish them.</p></div>    <div class="reply">          </div><!-- .reply -->  </div><!-- #comment-##  -->  </li><!-- #comment-## -->  <li class="comment even thread-even depth-1" id="li-comment-9486437">    <div id="comment-9486437">    <div class="comment-author vcard">            <cite class="fn"><a href="http://shorpy.com" rel="external nofollow" class="url">toshiro_mifune</a></cite> <span class="says">says:</span>    </div><!-- .comment-author .vcard -->        <div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"><a href="https://www.theamericanconservative.com/articles/ocasio-cortez-puts-the-postal-service-on-the-path-to-ruin/#comment-9486437">      May 17, 2019 at 9:32 am</a>    </div><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata -->    <div class="comment-body"><p>Didn’t the US already have a Post Office Savings Bank? From what I’ve read it was successful in its intended goal of bringing banking services to un/under-served rural areas.<br>Wouldn’t a new version be similar albeit with a focus on un/under served urban areas?</p></div>    <div class="reply">          </div><!-- .reply -->  </div><!-- #comment-##  -->  </li><!-- #comment-## -->  <li class="comment odd alt thread-odd thread-alt depth-1" id="li-comment-9486567">    <div id="comment-9486567">    <div class="comment-author vcard">            <cite class="fn"><a href="https://siarlysjenkins.blogspot.com" rel="external nofollow" class="url">Siarlys Jenkins</a></cite> <span class="says">says:</span>    </div><!-- .comment-author .vcard -->        <div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"><a href="https://www.theamericanconservative.com/articles/ocasio-cortez-puts-the-postal-service-on-the-path-to-ruin/#comment-9486567">      May 17, 2019 at 10:22 am</a>    </div><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata -->    <div class="comment-body"><p>The post office is probably not the best engine for this proposal. But the substance of it is pure, unadulterated original Populism. One of the basic demands of the agrarian People’s Party was that the federal government establish sub-treasuries in each state to provide low interest lones to farmers, getting them out from under the usurious exploitation of “The Furnishing Man,” or “The Hiring Man,” or, to Americans of African descent, simply, “The Man.”</p></div>    <div class="reply">          </div><!-- .reply -->  </div><!-- #comment-##  -->  </li><!-- #comment-## -->  <li class="comment even thread-even depth-1" id="li-comment-9487036">    <div id="comment-9487036">    <div class="comment-author vcard">            <cite class="fn">MM</cite> <span class="says">says:</span>    </div><!-- .comment-author .vcard -->        <div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"><a href="https://www.theamericanconservative.com/articles/ocasio-cortez-puts-the-postal-service-on-the-path-to-ruin/#comment-9487036">      May 17, 2019 at 1:03 pm</a>    </div><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata -->    <div class="comment-body"><p>William: “Oh, and the post office wouldn’t be in such trouble is Republicans hadn’t forced such absurd pension fund demands on them to punish them.”</p><p>You mean requiring this government entity to actually fully fund health benefits, not pension benefits incidentally, that they already promised to pay out in the future?</p><p>Yep, that’s truly absurd. Too bad the USPS isn’t like the rest of the federal government, passing the buck to taxpayers when they don’t have enough money to cover their own damn bills…</p></div>    <div class="reply">          </div><!-- .reply -->  </div><!-- #comment-##  -->  </li><!-- #comment-## -->  <li class="comment odd alt thread-odd thread-alt depth-1" id="li-comment-9487120">    <div id="comment-9487120">    <div class="comment-author vcard">            <cite class="fn">Bill Haywood</cite> <span class="says">says:</span>    </div><!-- .comment-author .vcard -->        <div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"><a href="https://www.theamericanconservative.com/articles/ocasio-cortez-puts-the-postal-service-on-the-path-to-ruin/#comment-9487120">      May 17, 2019 at 1:26 pm</a>    </div><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata -->    <div class="comment-body"><p>The author assumes the PO will not charge enough interest to cover defaults in order to prove his point, but there is no reason to do so.</p><p>Note that unlike payday lenders, the PO already has storefronts and infrastructure, and as the PO gets used more, it will sell more money orders, too.</p></div>    <div class="reply">          </div><!-- .reply -->  </div><!-- #comment-##  -->  </li><!-- #comment-## -->  <li class="comment even thread-even depth-1" id="li-comment-9487313">    <div id="comment-9487313">    <div class="comment-author vcard">            <cite class="fn">sglover</cite> <span class="says">says:</span>    </div><!-- .comment-author .vcard -->        <div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"><a href="https://www.theamericanconservative.com/articles/ocasio-cortez-puts-the-postal-service-on-the-path-to-ruin/#comment-9487313">      May 17, 2019 at 2:17 pm</a>    </div><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata -->    <div class="comment-body"><p>@ Joe O’Mahony — thanks for your remark.  It speaks volumes that Marchand somehow never gets around to mentioning that little tidbit.  But that would jeopardize that sweet right-wing welfare money.  Marchand doesn’t seem to know much or anything about USPS finances, but I’m sure he’s acutely attentive to his own.</p><p>For its part, The American Con is really nothing more than a disbursing window for said welfare trough.</p></div>    <div class="reply">          </div><!-- .reply -->  </div><!-- #comment-##  -->  </li><!-- #comment-## -->  <li class="comment odd alt thread-odd thread-alt depth-1" id="li-comment-9487747">    <div id="comment-9487747">    <div class="comment-author vcard">            <cite class="fn">TR</cite> <span class="says">says:</span>    </div><!-- .comment-author .vcard -->        <div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"><a href="https://www.theamericanconservative.com/articles/ocasio-cortez-puts-the-postal-service-on-the-path-to-ruin/#comment-9487747">      May 17, 2019 at 3:55 pm</a>    </div><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata -->    <div class="comment-body"><p>This guy is a Koch Brothers shill.  TAC ought to be embarrassed, at least unless they’re charging him advertising rates for his biased information.</p></div>    <div class="reply">          </div><!-- .reply -->  </div><!-- #comment-##  -->  </li><!-- #comment-## -->  <li class="comment even thread-even depth-1" id="li-comment-9488103">    <div id="comment-9488103">    <div class="comment-author vcard">            <cite class="fn"><a href="http://anabaptist.exoss.net" rel="external nofollow" class="url">Fran Macadam</a></cite> <span class="says">says:</span>    </div><!-- .comment-author .vcard -->        <div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"><a href="https://www.theamericanconservative.com/articles/ocasio-cortez-puts-the-postal-service-on-the-path-to-ruin/#comment-9488103">      May 17, 2019 at 5:21 pm</a>    </div><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata -->    <div class="comment-body"><p>If ever there is sinful usury, it is unquestionably the Payday Loan sharks.</p><p>You think they help people? They help themselves to the remaining assets of those who can’t pay, which is the intention of their trap. Worse than, but just like the credit card banksters who best love those who carry large balances and have to pay maximum interest.</p></div>    <div class="reply">          </div><!-- .reply -->  </div><!-- #comment-##  -->  </li><!-- #comment-## -->  <li class="comment odd alt thread-odd thread-alt depth-1" id="li-comment-9488748">    <div id="comment-9488748">    <div class="comment-author vcard">            <cite class="fn">Chris Mallory</cite> <span class="says">says:</span>    </div><!-- .comment-author .vcard -->        <div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"><a href="https://www.theamericanconservative.com/articles/ocasio-cortez-puts-the-postal-service-on-the-path-to-ruin/#comment-9488748">      May 17, 2019 at 7:53 pm</a>    </div><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata -->    <div class="comment-body"><p>“by law it must pre-pay pension and health care costs something the rest of the government and private business are not required to do.”</p><p>Considering the massive shortfalls state run government pensions are facing, it is a shame the rest of government was not required to fully fund pensions.  Now I am going to have my taxes raised to pay for promises made by politicians decades ago.   Better the states go bankrupt.</p></div>    <div class="reply">          </div><!-- .reply -->  </div><!-- #comment-##  -->  </li><!-- #comment-## -->  <li class="comment even thread-even depth-1" id="li-comment-9492963">    <div id="comment-9492963">    <div class="comment-author vcard">            <cite class="fn">Marty</cite> <span class="says">says:</span>    </div><!-- .comment-author .vcard -->        <div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"><a href="https://www.theamericanconservative.com/articles/ocasio-cortez-puts-the-postal-service-on-the-path-to-ruin/#comment-9492963">      May 18, 2019 at 3:30 pm</a>    </div><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata -->    <div class="comment-body"><p>Payday lenders are exemplary, top-notch businesses! Hahaha…</p></div>    <div class="reply">          </div><!-- .reply -->  </div><!-- #comment-##  -->  </li><!-- #comment-## -->  <li class="comment odd alt thread-odd thread-alt depth-1" id="li-comment-9493427">    <div id="comment-9493427">    <div class="comment-author vcard">            <cite class="fn">Salamander</cite> <span class="says">says:</span>    </div><!-- .comment-author .vcard -->        <div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"><a href="https://www.theamericanconservative.com/articles/ocasio-cortez-puts-the-postal-service-on-the-path-to-ruin/#comment-9493427">      May 18, 2019 at 5:23 pm</a>    </div><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata -->    <div class="comment-body"><p>This is the single most intellectually dishonest essay I’ve ever read on TAC.  It speaks volumes about the character of its author.</p></div>    <div class="reply">          </div><!-- .reply -->  </div><!-- #comment-##  -->  </li><!-- #comment-## -->			</ol>	<div id="respond"
